channel.title: Mosquitto+AirVatage+MqttClient on mangOH Green with wp7607?
channel.description:
Hi :grinning: I’m working for the first time with mangOH green. I am having a little difficulty in understanding how communication with Mosquitto MQTT broker works. In particular, I did not understand how to send messages and especially how to program and put together the three elements:
* Mosquitto * MqttClient based on Paho * AirVantage (which could be used as a broker?). Could you by any chance be kind enough to explain to me how these elements interact with each other? Have I to work in the paho-based folder?
https://github.com/mangOH/MqttClient/tree/use_paho_linux_version
Contribute to mangOH/MqttClient development by creating an account on GitHub.
I installed Mosquitto on my virtual machine, I also made some small pub / sub applications, but I really don’t know how to use it in a larger project. I also registered my mangOH device on AirVantage. I would also be very happy if you knew of any tutorials. Thank you very much for your attention and again sorry for the inconvenience.

item.title: Mosquitto+AirVatage+MqttClient on mangOH Green with wp7607?
item.dc:creator: pinst
item.description:
Your error above is because there is already a server running. If you did an install of mosquitto the server will come up after boot. For my example I killed the existing server so I could start a new one and show the output.

The C iibrary source can be found under “MQTT Clients” on this page:

https://www.eclipse.org/paho/index.php?page=downloads.php

Read full topic
item.source: Mosquitto+AirVatage+MqttClient on mangOH Green with wp7607?

item.title: Mosquitto+AirVatage+MqttClient on mangOH Green with wp7607?
item.dc:creator: pinst
item.description:
I am not using Sierra Wireless’ MQTT Client, I am using the paho MQTT library within my application.

Here is the mosquitto server receiving a message from the paho standalone client program. Unfortunately I’m not set up to run my application on the SW at this time.

$ /snap/mosquitto/current/usr/sbin/mosquitto -v -c /snap/mosquitto/current/default_config.conf
1618337359: mosquitto version 1.6.14 starting
1618337359: Config loaded from /snap/mosquitto/current/default_config.conf.
1618337359: Opening ipv4 listen socket on port 1883.
1618337359: Opening ipv6 listen socket on port 1883.
1618337359: mosquitto version 1.6.14 running
1618337682: New connection from 127.0.0.1 on port 1883.
1618337682: New client connected from 127.0.0.1 as paho-c-pub (p2, c1, k10).
1618337682: No will message specified.
1618337682: Sending CONNACK to paho-c-pub (0, 0)
1618337682: Received PUBLISH from paho-c-pub (d0, q0, r0, m0, 'mytopic', ... (5 bytes))
1618337682: Received DISCONNECT from paho-c-pub
1618337682: Client paho-c-pub disconnected.

$ paho_c_pub -c localhost -t mytopic -m hello

Read full topic

item.title: Mosquitto+AirVatage+MqttClient on mangOH Green with wp7607?
item.dc:creator: pinst
item.description:
I have set up a configuration with MQTT client on mangOH, mosquitto server on PC, mosquitto client on same PC. Can publish from mangOH client and receive on PC client.

It’s a Linux PC though. You have to set up the iptables on LInux to allow the mangOH to send to it. Not familiar with how you do it on Windows.

Read full topic
item.source: Mosquitto+AirVatage+MqttClient on mangOH Green with wp7607?

item.dc:creator: jyijyi
item.description:
No problem is found in the sample app

github.com

legatoproject/legato-af/blob/master/apps/sample/mqtt/mqttPublisher.adef

sandboxed: true
start: auto

executables:
{
    testPublisher       = (testPublisher)
}

processes:
{
    run:
    {
        (testPublisher)
    }

    faultAction: restart
}

bindings:
{
